title: Menorca
summary: Menorca[lower-alpha 1] or Minorca[lower-alpha 2] (from Latin: Insula Minor, lit. 'smaller island', later Minorica) is one of the Balearic Islands located in the Mediterranean Sea belonging to Spain. Its name derives from its size, contrasting it with nearby Mallorca. Its largest city and capital is Mahón (Catalan: Maó), situated on the island's eastern side, although Menorca is not a province and forms a political union with the other islands in the archipelago.
